titleStmt.title: By the King a proclamation for restraint of killing, dressing, and eating of flesh in Lent, or on fish dayes, appointed by the law, to be hereafter strictly obserued by all sorts of people.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, Printers to the Kings most Excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: Arms with initials "C R" at top. Sheet 3, line 4, has "Our vse".
"Giuen at Our Court at White-Hall, the fourteenth day of Ianuary, in the first yeere of Our Reigne of Great Britaine, France and Ireland."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
